meanings.definition: Not absorbed or integrated into a culture or society.
meanings.sent1: The unassimilated traditions of the new immigrants stood out in the community.
meanings.sent2: The foreign language remained unassimilated in the small town.
meanings.sent3: The unassimilated fashion choices of the teenager raised some eyebrows.
meanings.sent4: Her unique perspective on the matter was like an unassimilated puzzle to her friends.
meanings.sent5: The unassimilated smell of exotic spices filled the kitchen.

meanings.definition: Not digested or metabolized by the body.
meanings.sent1: The unassimilated nutrients in the food passed through the body unused.
meanings.sent2: The doctor was concerned about the unassimilated vitamins in the patient's diet.
meanings.sent3: The unassimilated supplements were just a waste of money.
meanings.sent4: Her unassimilated diet left her feeling weak and tired.
meanings.sent5: The unassimilated medication caused unexpected side effects.

meanings.sent1: The unassimilated scientific concepts confused the students.
meanings.sent2: The professor's lecture on quantum physics left many unassimilated ideas in the students' minds.
meanings.sent3: The unassimilated instructions led to a lot of mistakes in the project.
meanings.sent4: His unassimilated explanation left everyone scratching their heads.
meanings.sent5: The unassimilated complexity of the situation made it hard to find a solution.
